New Records: Luka Modric became the oldest scorer in European Championship history with a goal at 38 years, 289 days
Key Match Events: Luka Modric gave Croatia a 55th-minute lead after missing a penalty
Mattia Zaccagni curled home a 98th-minute equaliser to level the score
Croatia's fans started to celebrate what they thought would be a victory before Italy struck a late blow
Pre-Game Insights: Italy had been rocked with defeat by Spain, but Croatia had been even less impressive in the event

Italy's coach Luciano Spalletti said there are things that happen in their matches that are illogical but they need to take what the boys have in their qualities and put them in a position to express themselves at their best
Post-Match Reflections: Luka Modric said it was very stressful, we kept battling until the end, but football was merciless with us tonight, it was cruel
Mattia Zaccagni said it was immense satisfaction, I'm excited, it's a beautiful evening, we did well to stay in the game with a great second half
Miscellaneous Highlights: Italy will next face Switzerland, who finished second in their group after a 1-1 draw with Germany on Sunday
The result left Italy second in Group B on four points, with Croatia third but now playing an anxious waiting game to see whether two points will be enough to take them through to the knockout stage
